meanings.definition: The act of cleaning something by scrubbing or rinsing it with water.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the mud, the children had to do the washups of their hands and faces.
meanings.sent2: The laundry room was filled with various washups waiting to be dried.
meanings.sent3: The washups of the muddy dog turned the bathtub into a mini swimming pool.
meanings.sent4: The washups of the dishes after the big dinner felt like a never-ending task.
meanings.sent5: The washups of the car in the driveway left it sparkling in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has been cleaned or washed.
meanings.sent1: The shiny car in the showroom was a perfect washups.
meanings.sent2: The washups of the windows made the whole house look brighter.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly showed off her washups teddy bear to her friends.
meanings.sent4: The washups clothes on the line fluttered in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The washups puppy wagged its tail happily after its bath.

meanings.definition: A sudden or unexpected arrival or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected washups of the long-lost friend brought tears of joy.
meanings.sent2: The washups of the storm caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The washups of the circus in town excited the children.
meanings.sent4: The washups of the new student in class disrupted the routine.
meanings.sent5: The washups of the shooting star across the night sky left everyone in awe.
